Enumeration Type Documentation

enum Mercury::ReliableTypeEnum

There are three types of reliability.

RELIABLE_PASSENGER messages will only be sent so long as there is at least one RELIABLE_DRIVER in the same Bundle. RELIABLE_CRITICAL means the same as RELIABLE_DRIVER, however, starting a message of this type also marks the Bundle as critical.

Enumerator:
RELIABLE_NO 
RELIABLE_DRIVER 
RELIABLE_PASSENGER 
RELIABLE_CRITICAL 

enum Mercury::NetworkInterfaceType

Enumerator:
NETWORK_INTERFACE_INTERNAL 
NETWORK_INTERFACE_EXTERNAL 

Function Documentation

bool Mercury::watcherStringToValue ( const char *  valueStr,
Address &  value 
)

This function converts a watcher string to an address.

std::string Mercury::watcherValueToString ( const Address &  value  ) 

This function converts an address to a watcher string.

BinaryOStream & Mercury::operator<< ( BinaryOStream &  os,
const Address &  a 
)

Output streaming for addresses.

Note that we don't use the streaming operators because they will do endian conversions on big endian systems. These values need to be in the same byte order on both systems so we just use the raw methods.

BinaryIStream & Mercury::operator>> ( BinaryIStream &  is,
Address &  a 
)

Input streaming for addresses.

bool Mercury::operator== ( const Mercury::Address &  a,
const Mercury::Address &  b 
) [inline]

This operator compares two addresses.

It returns true if the IP addresses and ports match.

Returns:
true if the addresses are equal, false otherwise.

bool Mercury::operator!= ( const Mercury::Address &  a,
const Mercury::Address &  b 
) [inline]

This operator compares two addresses.

It returns true if the IP addresses and ports do not match.

Returns:
true if the addresses are non-equal, false otherwise.

bool Mercury::operator< ( const Mercury::Address &  a,
const Mercury::Address &  b 
) [inline]

This operator compares two addresses.

It is needed for using an address as a key in an STL map.

Returns:
true if a is less than b, false otherwise.
